items.title: Trump Administration Asks Colleges to Sign ‘Compact’ to Get Funding Preference
items.summary: Demands sent to nine top schools included pledging to freeze tuition for five years and to commit to strict definitions of gender.

items.title: NTSB Faults Philadelphia Transit Agency Over Train Fires
items.summary: The National Transportation Safety Board said hundreds of aging rail cars should be taken out of service until they can be replaced or retrofitted.

items.title: For Workers, Mixed Signals. For the Public, Limited Impact on Shutdown’s First Day.
items.summary: Federal agencies gave shifting and mixed guidance to their work forces about who should come to work and who shouldn’t, but the initial effect on services appeared scattered and limited.

items.title: ‘Dangerous Cities,’ the Military, Trump and the Founding Fathers
items.summary: The U.S. armed services have long sought to preserve the tradition of a nonpartisan military.

items.title: White House Seeks to Blunt Democrats’ Shutdown Strategy on Health Care
items.summary: President Trump has made lowering health care costs a key priority, even as Democrats warn that costs will skyrocket.

items.title: The Be-Careful-What-You-Wish-For Shutdown
items.summary: Unlike in shutdowns past, President Trump is the wild card.

items.title: White House plays racist deepfake video of Democratic leaders on loop
items.summary: <p>JD Vance, the VP, said he thought the video was ‘funny’ and the ‘sombrero memes’ would cease if government reopened</p><p>As the <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/trump-administration">Trump administration</a> insists it is serious about negotiating an end to the government shutdown, a pair of racist deepfake videos mocking Democratic leaders played on a loop in the White House briefing room for hours on Wednesday.</p><p>The videos, posted by Trump on his social media platform on Monday, use <a href="https://truthsocial.com/@realDonaldTrump/posts/115290424560405640">fabricated audio</a> to make it seem as if the Senate minority leader, Chuck Schumer, called Democrats “woke pieces of shit”, and showed the House minority leader, Hakeem Jeffries, with a fake mustache and sombrero.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/01/trump-racist-deepfake-video-jeffries-schumer">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Perky Maxwell House viral ad takes on housing crisis as ‘Maxwell Apartment’
items.summary: <p>Historic US company also offering ‘12-month lease’ – an annual supply – of pre-ground coffee for under $40</p><p>Housing in the US has become so unaffordable that a coffee company has based a viral marketing campaign on the idea that almost nobody can afford to buy a house.</p><p>Maxwell House coffee, a 133-year-old brand, recently launched a marketing campaign rebranding themselves as “Maxwell Apartment Coffee”.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/01/maxwell-house-ad-campaign-apartment">Continue reading...</a>
